comments.body: Great Idea

good idea! There should be 2 levels. The first one should give the player 1.5x their normal experience points and the second level should give the player 2.0x their normal experience points. I think it would be cool if it was called ‚Äúgreed‚Äù or something like that.

The enchantment can be called "learning."
In adition to weapons, it should also applyable to pickaxes, hoes, and fishing-rods, for use on ores, skulk, and fishing exp. By extention, it should also be mutually-exclusive with silk-touch.
This is too OP. Plus, we wouldn't be able to improve the EXP uses if this was added.

I think it would be nice if it had 3 levels and was exclusive with mending and looting/fortune. That way you can't infinitely repair it with mending + lots of extra XP, but you also have to choose between wanting extra loot from monsters / ores or if you want extra XP.
I agree. A homogeneous brick is already dazzling in the eyes, cracks will add variety.
Then what are the uses of this fine dirt? Please mention.
Sounds good! (Also, is this for bedrock of for Java? Both sounds good!)
@ Tobiah Hewitt I think it'd work for both versions of Minecraft! After all, Realms are on both versions, and it's good for close-knit communities like those ^u^
They have had that in Minecraft it was called stunned armer but it did not look like that
and mountain biomes, not extreme mountain biomes. They can be on rocks and erode it overime, like 400 minecraft days

I like this, but I think instead of it being a new grass-type block, it can grow stones, stone-based blocks, and trees. It starts out as a single pixel, and during each growth stage (20 Minecraft days?) doubles in size. It comes in a few different colors- russet (reddish brown), yellow, light green, dark green, gray-green, blue-gray, and blue. These are the kinds I remember from hiking (There's probably more).

The color of lichen that grows in a single lichen growth stage is completely random, albeit weighted toward the types already growing on the block.

We can replace the moss stone boulders in taigas with lichen stones, and of course it would grow on trees. It would also grow all over the hills and extreme hills, a little in the jungle, and the shores of Mushroom islands (being part fungus, part algae, it grows where algae (from the ocean) meets the fungus (mycelium).
First!
I think this is a great idea, but I don't know if it should go up to 8 tiers.
I think I might prefer the suggestion someone made about netherite doubling a shulkerbox's inventory space. Nested shulkers seems like an overpowered hassle.
I think that each tier should give you one more space for a Tier I shulker box (Tier II have two slots for normal shulkers, Tier III have three slots etc.)
I would have certain links in the bars be broken. Not like the spawner is ripped open, just a more weathered look
Maybe the interdimensional indicator is a greenish/orangeish/yellowish compass needle?

This is a cool idea, dang I just thought of it and bam someone else already suggested it!

Yeah pairing Nether portals requires F3. With the linked compass pointing in the overworld the 8x8 area of the nether where the Lodestone is, would be really cool

The End feature, if it works only on activated end portals I'm ok with that , it will not substitute the endereyes since u still need to use them to find the portal in the first place and new unactivated ones in order to place a Lodestone in the End.
Um Aren‚Äôt Ender Pearl Stacking To 64 In Combat Snapshots
Yes, i agree. It would make the game more realistic. It would change a very tiny part of the game, so i dont see why mojang couldnt make this change.

This would be a bad change. Inventory management is already annoying when things don't stack all the way to 64 for no reason. In my opinion, everything should stack to 64 unless it has a balancing, technical, or practical reason not to. So tools/armor shouldn't stack, powerful combat items like splash potions and water/lava buckets shouldn't stack, and perhaps boats/minecarts shouldn't stack. But almost everything else should just stack all the way to 64.

We need to help inventory management, not make it even more frustrating. The ender pearl stack size should be changed to match eyes of ender, not the other way around. Ender pearls already have a cooldown mechanic to help balance them, and I personally don't think having large stacks of ender pearls is too overpowered, since you do take damage every time you use them.
I will do this on my server. it just makes sense.

How did you do this? I‚Äôve spent the last 6 hours trying to do this myself but can‚Äôt. I can‚Äôt even figure out how to see the code, so most of that time has been spent trying to make a datapacks for this. Please please please help me

THIS

I've been looking for one for six hours and have travelled 50,000 blocks in the overworld and still haven't found one :(
I saw this on r/shittymcsuggestions and i actually think this is a good idea

I would actually posit a flat light that's trapdoor thick, and not pressure plate. I wouldn't be opposed to trapdoor mechanics (where it can pivot 90*), but I would make it function differently from a trapdoor in terms of mob pathfinding and interaction with redstone elements. I think that, like most other lights, it should be an always on option. That said, I would also like to see redstone toggle-able options, like the copper bulb or redstone lamp!

Bonus for a handful of different colors/face designs. It could work like frog lights, or even use them as a build element, with the three tones to match different build styles. I would also like to see different face designs (an acacia trapdoor adds a very different visual element from an oak, or an acacia, for example). On the topic of manufacturing these aforementioned lights in-game, I think I would make the build require a frog light and 3 iron bars (crafting table only), and maybe pop out two of the lights (similar to trap doors). With the love that copper has gotten lately, I wouldn't be opposed to copper as the design metal, either!

The redstone versions, I think, I would set up similar to redstone lamps, but combine glowstone powder, redstone powder (or block??), and the aforementioned metals. Food for thought for the devs, hopefully!

 

I think a block like this would add greater depth and flexibility to builds, allow for cleaner recessed lighting, and potentially add a new farm/gameplay loop to the game.

I was actually thinking about this earlier, and how it would encourage road making. But, I think instead of a speed boost on roads, it makes more sense that we just go slower on grass.

I mean, walking on grass slows you down just a little bit in reality, so this does make sense. But nobody wants a nerf to player speed, so I guess increase speed on hard surfaces by, say 2% of the current speed, and then reduce speed on grass blocks by 2%.

This is just numbers I'm throwing out though.
Well instead of nerfing speed or a speed boost to the player, if you want roads, how about minecart speed is increased on concrete? People will now have incentive to use minecarts.
Player speed should be increased on concrete, grass path, wood planks, and sandstone. It would be slight, and most noticeable on concrete.
Very good Idea! I vote!!!
Where would this block be found, and what purpose would it have.

____________________________________________________
PlutonicPoet34 commented:
 
Where would this block be found, and what purpose would it have.
_____________________________________________________
Well, it will be found large open space in the nether, as well frequently in caves, in fortresses, and long corridors.

So, it's just a block that generates in both the nether and the Overworld, that simply hurts the player. It needs a reason to explain why it exists so it's not just some random block that serves only to be a nuisance when caving. It kind of makes sense in the nether though.

But, again, what purpose would it have? Sure, it could be used in mob farms, but besides being an annoyance while adventuring, players would just walk around it, or dig it up to throw it away.
It good when drop by wither
isn't this just re-textured magma blocks
why do people want a block in the game that just makes it harder to win??? if your fighting the ender dragon and your winning and then you stand on this block and die a lot of people would be annoyed
That would be a nice feature

Great idea. I intuitively assumed that this would already be implemented, but was shocked to find out it isn't. It's not a big deal but would definitely make the game feel more coherent and intuitive for probably not much coding effort (compared to other features).
This would be easier for brewing :D
Yea, its so hard to find a fortress and not die :/

Cobblestone should turn into blackstone only through an interaction with lava.
Wouldn't that be like using a lead, but on a turtle?
I definitely agree, because I can compost egg shells fine in my backyard. But my backyard in Minecraft? Cmon, man.
I have more eggs than I can handle.  It takes entirely too much time to empty my egg chest connected to my chicken farm.   Making them compostable would be a huge quality of life improvement.

This seems like a really cool idea but I can imagine it would be rejected as the function of this may be getting too much into the "guns" category of items which Mojang has specifically stated will never be added to Minecraft. As cool as it is, it most likely wont be accepted.
Sweet
Can I have it
I think this would be better made from iron. A different texture for more industrial builds.

I just had this same idea! Use string + scaffold to make it stronger and extend further. I hate that one miss-click of my mouse will cause my scaffolding to come tumbling down. Would love a way to make it stronger!

I also think this could be solved by doing Iron/Copper scaffolding though.

Considering they'd be end game anyways I definitely support this idea. I actually already use a bucket (place it and quickly pick it back up so you can use riptide) for the same thing already, but lingering potion would be a more convenient (albeit consumable) way of doing the same thing.

 

I also thing that just being in the lingering water effect should also give you the effect of a nearby conduit too.
Changing the ink color would be great!
It's too rare to be relevant
